Sentencas: Natural gas (NG) and liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) are important potential feedstocks for the production of hydrogen for fuel cell-based (e.g. proton exchange membrane fuel cells (PEMFC) or solid oxide fuel Cells (SOFC) combined heat and power (CHP) applications.
Titulo: Removal of sulphur-containing odorants from fuel gases for fuel cell-based combined heat and power applications

Sentencas: To prevent detrimental effects on the (electro)catalysts in fuel cell-based combined heat and power installations (FC-CHP), sulphur removal from the feedstock is mandatory.
Titulo: Removal of sulphur-containing odorants from fuel gases for fuel cell-based combined heat and power applications

Sentencas: An experimental bench-marking study of adsorbents has identified several candidates for the removal of sulphur containing odorants at low temperature.
Titulo: Removal of sulphur-containing odorants from fuel gases for fuel cell-based combined heat and power applications

Sentencas: Among these adsorbents a new material has been discovered that offers an economically attractive means to remove TetraHydroThiophene (THT), the main European odorant, from natural gas at ambient temperature.
Titulo: Removal of sulphur-containing odorants from fuel gases for fuel cell-based combined heat and power applications

Sentencas: The material is environmentally benign, easy to use and possesses good activity (residual sulphur levels below 20 ppbv) and capacity for the common odorant THT in natural gas.
Titulo: Removal of sulphur-containing odorants from fuel gases for fuel cell-based combined heat and power applications

Sentencas: When compared to state-of-the-art metal-promoted active carbon the new material has a THT uptake capacity that is up to 10 times larger, depending on temperature and pressure.
Titulo: Removal of sulphur-containing odorants from fuel gases for fuel cell-based combined heat and power applications

Sentencas: Promoted versions of the new material have shown potential for the removal of THT at higher temperatures and/or for the removal of other odorants such as mercaptans from natural gas or from LPG.
Titulo: Removal of sulphur-containing odorants from fuel gases for fuel cell-based combined heat and power applications
